newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Ciba says to label gene maize.
newsitem.headline: Ciba says to label gene maize.

text.p: Swiss chemicals and pharmaceuticals group Ciba-Geigy AG, on the threshold of merging with Sandoz AG into Novartis, said it would label its seed bags that contain genetically altered maize.

In a statement welcoming the European Commission's approval for the cultivation, import and use of genetically modified maize, the head of Ciba Seeds Daniel Blancpain also said Ciba would voluntarily implement programmes to monitor potential resistance development in the European corn borer.
The maize, Bt-maize, was developed to be resistant to the corn borer, which destroys up to 20 percent of the potential maize harvest, Ciba said.
Eighty percent of the maize harvest is used as animal feed and food stuffs containing this maize in processed form will also be labelled according to the EU Novel Food Regulation.

"Ciba is labelling its seed bags contraining the genetically improved maize and will also voluntarily implement programmes to monitor potential resistance development in ECB (European corn borer)," Blancpain said.
Earlier today the European Commission said it welcomed a letter from Ciba from December 17 in which the company said it was ready to label bags that contained the altered seeds.
